intro: Fagara cabrae, commonly known as the Cuban fagara, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, native to the Caribbean region, particularly Cuba. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature, containing several seeds. Fagara cabrae is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various bird and insect species. Its botanical features make it an important component of the biodiversity in its native habitat.
